TWITTER_NOTES: The values below are retrieved from Twitter's API app interface.  When you create a Twitter API app, you will
receive the consumer key and consumer secret as part of the app.  You will need to separately
create the access token, which will give you the values for access_token and access_token_secret.
Paste the values for each of these inside the quotes below, next to the corresponding key.
FLICKR_NOTES: Flickr uses Oauth like Twitter, but it supports app-only access for the endpoints we want,
so only the consumer key/secret items are needed (of course, the values will *not* be the
same as the ones used for Twitter auth)
LICENSE_NOTES: The flickr license IDs as currently understood that we'll allow:
Others you may want to enable, but require you to declare licenses:
INTERVAL_NOTES: If you'd like to change the frequency of posting from the default 24 hours (86400000ms),
set it with the interval key here.  Note that 120000(ms) is the minimum that will be accepted
